newsitem.title: USA: Massachusetts official seeks probe of ad agency.
newsitem.headline: Massachusetts official seeks probe of ad agency.

text.p: A state senator is seeking a probe into allegations of financial improprieties by one of Boston's top advertising agencies in connection with two state contracts it won, The Boston Globe reported on Friday.

Senator Diane Wilkerson asked in a letter to the Massachusetts inspector general to determine the validity of allegations leveled against Houston Herstek Favat, Inc, by a former executive who said he was fired by the agency because he is gay, the newspaper said.

Houston Herstek landed a five-year, $11 million-a-year contract from the Massachusetts Department of Public Health to implement part of the state's anti-smoking campaign. It also has a multimillion-dollar contract from the state's Office of Travel and Tourism.

The former executive filed a gender discrimination complaint against Houston Hertek earlier this week in which he alleged the agency "donated" $20,000 to the American Cancer Society with the understanding the society would use half the money to help the agency secure the anti-smoking contract.
Representatives from Houston Herstek, Wilkerson and Inspector General Robert Cerasoli were not immediately available for comment.
